intro: Scleria buchananii, commonly known as the African bulbous grass, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its bulbous base and grass-like leaves, which are often used in traditional medicine. Scleria buchananii typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in grasslands and riverine areas. Its flowering stems produce small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in dense spikes.
